thread.title: United volleyball team plays Southeastern tough in loss
thread.title_full: United volleyball team plays Southeastern tough in loss

author: Jeff Holt
title: United volleyball team plays Southeastern tough in loss
text: United volleyball team plays Southeastern tough in loss Comment Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 9:40   21, 2015 at 9:40 PM It almost felt like a postseason battle. United's Natalie Johnson, Addison McKee and Lauren Sperry took centerstage Wednesday on Senior Night in a 25-16, 23-25 and 26-24 loss to a tough Southeastern team. "They are going to be missed," said United coach Carrie Boone, about her three seniors. "The good thing is that this will not be their last match played here at United with regionals next week. Our defense looked great and I told the girls we finished the (regular) season at 30-5 and all of our losses were to really good teams." Sperry had another solid match in the front row with 9 kills, 2 blocks and 3 aces. Junior Mallory Flynn also had 23 assists for the Red Storm. United also closed out the regular season with a 9-1 mark to win the Lincoln Trail Conference. Southeastern (29-3), led by 5-11 junior Kolby McClellund was a perfect tuneup before going into regionals next week. McClellund, at times, took the match over with her jump serves and play at the net. "Coming in, we knew it was going to be a great volleyball match with two great programs," said Southeastern coach Dave Kerr. "We've really developed a good rivalry. We knew they had a great record and a great team. They play hard and are very well-coached. This is one that we wanted going into our postseason. It was a battle and felt like whoever got the final serve was going to win." About the play of McClelland, Kerr said, "Without question, she's the best player I've coached in my 18 or 19 years. As a junior, she's been getting some Division I looks and has been our go-to player. We haven't found too many people who can stop her." The second set featured ties at 7, 13, 15, 17, 18, 21, 22, and 23 before the Red Storm won it. The third and decisive set, though, saw United watch a 22-20 slip away. United will host the regional next week and return to the court on Tuesday at 6 p.m. against the winner of West Central and Abingdon-Avon. By Jeff Holt
